entries.text: Larry Wall will be a guest speaker for the 3rd anniversary of Cluj.pm. In other news, Cluj.pm is already 3 years old? Geeee, time sure flies...
entries.title: The Creator of Perl is Coming to Romania
entries.author: tudor_constantin

entries.title: Rex turns 1.0.0
entries.text: The deployment and configuration management tool Rex reached v1.0.0.

entries.title: Call for Venue for YAPC::Europe::2016
entries.text: This year, it's all happening in Granada. But next year...? The call for venues is officially on and, if you desire to have YAPC be in your city, you have until May the 15th to send your letter of intent to the committee.

entries.title: Perl in February
entries.text: Karen recaps what has been going in the organizational world of Perl. Conferences are prepared, programs are readied, grants are evaluated. In short, business as usual (which, mind you, is an excellent thing).
entries.author: karen_pauley
breno_de_oliveira
entries.text: Badges are nifty. Want to add some to your GitHub README.md and your metaCPAN POD? Garu is going to show you how.
entries.title: How to add online code badges to your Perl projects
The top 10 hosts for CPAN repositories
entries.text: Where do the repositories of CPAN modules live? Neil crunched the numbers and share the result. Spoiler alert: if GitHub goes down, it won't be pretty.
entries.author: neil_bowers

entries.title: Dear Lazyblog
entries.text: Want to have your stuff talked about at the German Linux Conference but won't be there? lichtkind might be the proxy you were looking for.

entries.title: Why I donated to the Perl QA Hackathon
entries.text: Camspi loves working with Perl. Ergo, he wants it to go on and flourish.  Hence his patronage of the Perl QA Hackaton.

entries.author: timm_murray
entries.title: GPS and Perl
entries.text: If you want to add some GPs functionality to your Raspberry Pi -- or anything else thats run Perl and has a GPS interface -- this article is for you.
perlancar shows how Perinci::CmdLine can takes away the drudgery of creating tabular output for command-line tools.
entries.title: Creating API-friendly CLI applications with parseable outputs
Quickly Debug your Perl code at the command line
entries.text: perl, the executable, comes with a vast panoply of command-line arguments. David covers here the most useful ones you absolutely need to know.
entries.author: david_farrell

entries.title: Writing XS Like a Pro - The INTERFACE Keyword
entries.text: XS coders, gather 'round, for Nick Wellnhofer is about to reveal the secrets of the INTERFACE keyword.

entries.title: 2015.10 FOSDEM Videos and Role Conflicts
entries.text: What happened on the Perl6 front this week. Plus a nice bunch of Perl6  videos from FOSDEM.
For everybody who ever asked the question, Moritz counts the ways.
entries.title: Why is it hard to write a compiler for Perl6?
entries.author: moritz_lenz

entries.title: CPAN great modules released last week

header: Numbers, numbers, everything revolve around numbers. Last week not only had a Friday the 13th, but also saw the celebrations of Pi Day (which mostly revolve around making math jokes and eating pies). This edition of the PW doesn't lack in numerals either: amongst other things, Rex turns 1, Neil hangs 10 (places most likely to host your module repository) and Timm has fun with GPS coordinates.  Enjoy! ~ `/anick
subject: It's All About Numbers
